review:
[h1] 右から来たものを受け流すゲーム [/h1]
画面右からのんびり攻めてくる敵軍を、画面左からのんびり出撃する自軍で叩きのめすゲーム。
アクションゲームではなく、ストラテジーなのでご注意を。

あらかじめ与えられたお金でユニットを生産すると、左端から出撃して死ぬまで敵陣に向かって進撃していく。
敵と遭遇したらその場に停止して射撃。
敵を破壊したらお金がもらえるので、それでまたユニットを生産するという流れ。

キャンペーンでは、いずれかの陣営の資金が枯渇すると決着する。

でもまあ、ストラテジーの割には戦略的な要素があまりなく、強ユニットのスパムや支援砲撃の連射でなんとかなってしまう。

対戦車ヘリを狩るのに戦車が有効など、ユニットの相性もほとんど考慮されていないっぽい。

グラフィックのセンスが非常に良く、100円以下のセールで販売されていたため「これは！」と思ったが、バグも多くどうにもならない。
せめてCPU同士で戦うモードがあれば、環境ソフトとして評価できたのに。

author: {'steamid': '76561198046042990', 'num_games_owned': 357, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1454711392}
review:
Отличная идея, шикарный минимализм, неплохая физика, хорошая тематика, приемлемая цена.

Что мы имеем? 2D стратегия в реальном времени.
Что это значит? Все просто:
-Нанимаете войска, они сами идут в бой (но можно и управлять)
-Убиваете врагов, получаете за это деньги
-Развиваете армию, становитесь сильнее
-Захватываете флаги, тем самым захватываете территорию

Игра вообще могла бы стать одной из моих любимых игр на ближайшее время, если бы не одно НО:
-Баги.
Игра с таким потенциалом портит все впечатление от количества багов, и судя по другим обзорам, разработчики и не думают ничего исправлять. Например экран может резко улететь влево, и ничем его не остановить, либо нажав на паузу, почти в конце битвы, выйти с нее я уже не смог.
Подобную игру можно было бы выпустить даже на Смартфоны, там любят подобное, но баги... баги испортили все.

И еще одно, если во время боя, "тени" (солдаты) выглядят минималистично и стильно, то вот интерфейс меню и начального экрана просто ужасен.

Надеюсь в будущем, кто нибудь осмелится выпустить нечто подобное на смартфоны, и тогда игру, 100% постигнет успех!

author: {'steamid': '76561197985215786', 'num_games_owned': 2073, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1420561523}
review:
È sempre difficile parlare di guerra: c’è chi prova a farlo in maniera “fanciullesca” raccontando fiabe per distogliere i fatti più crudi (Valiant Hearts) e chi invece pone l’accento proprio sugli effetti di questa sulle altre parti in gioco (This War Of Mine). Infine ci sono anche loro, gli sviluppatori che, come TRI.G raccolgono la sfida nella maniera più semplice e ritornano a mostrare la macchina bellica e i suoi scontri sul campo.
Non fatevi fregare come ha fatto il nostro Andrea (che mi ha bellamente preso in giro): Shadows Of War non è la versione di LIMBO in salsa violenta, ma forse sarebbe stato meglio se lo fosse stato. Quello che però lo accomuna con il famoso gioco di Playdead sono sicuramente lo stile grafico e la capacità di ricreare atmosfere particolari sfruttando semplici ombre. Attraverso le silhouette di truppe e veicoli, infatti, guideremo il nostro assalto al nemico cercando di conquistare la mappa prima di lui raggiungendo l’altro estremo visibile.

Per far ciò, dovremo selezionare le nostre unità dal menu inferiore, mandandole direttamente sul campo di battaglia una volta prodotte. Come recitano gli sviluppatori stessi, di fatto le meccaniche sono un mix tra uno strategico classico con le regole di sasso-carta-forbice e uno “a sciame” in 2D (ricordate Planets Under Attack?): nel tentativo di controllare la mappa — da cui le nostre truppe entreranno da un bordo per uscire dall’altro — dovremo sguinzagliare a grappolo le nostre unità, lanciandoci in produzione continua e oculata per riuscire ad avere la meglio sulle truppe del nemico. Proprio come nel nostro caso, anche lui produrrà unità di volta in volta, lanciando sul campo lo stesso tipo di unità nostre… e per stesso intendo anche a livello di forme. In fondo lo sfruttare una soluzione ad ombre permette ben poca varietà grafica, riducendo le differenze di plotoni alla semplice direzione in cui si spostano. Al contrario, un plauso va sicuramente fatto ai colori del cielo che influiscono nel creare il giusto clima di guerra, anche grazie all’ottimo accompagnamento sonoro che ritma i movimento dei nostri scontri.

Ora, a questo punto Shadows Of War potrebbe pure essere definito un bel gioco, uno di quelli che necessita anche un minimo di cervello per essere portato avanti, visto che i fondi a nostra disposizione per arruolare truppe andranno drasticamente crollando e dovremo usarli oculatamente per le sette missioni previste. Il punto, però, è che Shadows Of War non è minimamente giocabile: una volta superato il primo quadro e lanciati verso il secondo, riceveremo come risposta per ogni livello successivo l’aver automaticamente vinto il conflitto, concludendo le gesta dei nostri eroi in circa due minuti. Un bug terrificante a più di una settimana dall’uscita su Steam (nonostante il gioco sia uscito su alter piattaforme già a settembre scorso) che non solo rovina l’esperienza, ma pone sotto l’occhio critico tutti gli altri difetti più o meno importanti che affliggono l’opera di TRI.G. Prima di tutto sul lato narrativo: instabile e terribilmente stereotipato, ci farà attendere un po’ prima di chiarire che stiamo affrontando una campagna bellica nei panni della Germania contro “la Russia tiranna e malvagia”, il tutto senza un vero motivo e una conclusione che potrebbe essere un ottimo incipit per il peggior film di serie B non-sense anti-americano.

Il secondo, già accennato, è quello della caratterizzazione del gioco stesso: come già detto, non esiste alcuna differenza tra gli schieramenti che si affrontano (per quello che sono riuscito a provare in modalità Skirmish), né tanto meno esiste la possibilità di modificarli o dare un tocco personale a quello che un genere profondo come la strategia può offrire. A concludere il tutto, si aggiungano anche sporadici caricamenti che non permettono di vedere assolutamente niente a schermo, con la conseguente necessità di riavviare la partita (e se stavate giocando in multiplayer, beh, problemi vostri). Insomma, ad oggi Shadows Of War è un prodotto totalmente incompleto e ricolmo di problemi. Non sono certo che una volta corretti questo possa raggiungere la sufficienza, ma pur non volendo essere troppo cattivo verso gli sviluppatori tedeschi, che hanno avuto un’idea piuttosto interessante, purtroppo la realizzazione fallace non può davvero meritare altro. Un vero peccato, posso solo sperare che col tempo i problemi vengano risolti. Fino ad allora, trovate il gioco a 8 euro su Steam rigorosamente in inglese.

Ho provato i bug di Shadows Of War grazie a un codice gentilmente offerto dagli sviluppatori.

4

CONSIGLIATO A
Chi spera che il gioco venga corretto per essere giocabile, chi cerca una sfida ibrida che richiede un'attenta gestione dei fondi e si accontenta di scontri confusionari tra ombre.

SCONSIGLIATO A
Chiunque stia cercando uno strategico unico, personalizzabile, chiaro e gestibile in ogni suo aspetto, chi non ne può più di questi proto tower offense da mobile gaming e, soprattutto, chi cerca un gioco che possa essere giocato.

review:
一开始看到宣传视频和图片觉得还是有点意思的。
然后就看到了好多人给了差评，说压抑，于是就打算试试。
我耐心的打了前三关，说实话也不是压抑，就是无聊。
然后大概得出下列槽点：
游戏名为：Shadows of War，顾名思义，基本就和皮影戏一样的表现方式。
然后士兵大致分为四类：人形、轻甲、重甲、空中，外加个辅助的支援。
就不说你的单位都是黑影就算了，尼玛背景也是深色的，我连坦克士兵都快看不见，更别提后面关卡还有草丛遮挡住，我到底是在看什么？更有意思的是F键可以打开闪光灯，打着灯笼看战斗？你见过哪个指挥官连自己的兵都找不到的么？
战斗是最重要的部分，也是最让人吐槽的部分。
背景BGM听着很让人想睡觉，最重要的音效也是一塌糊涂，士兵挂了没声音，坦克爆了闷声屁，飞机掉了也一样。
后来发现可以给单位有轮廓边线的选项，终于不是那么瞎狗眼了。哎哟我去所有单位选择时都一个声线闹哪样？是不是因为开发者只有一个人？
几乎没有任何战术可言，就是飞机坦克一起上，小兵轻甲车都是渣渣。
战斗节奏太慢，这个至少是3倍速才算是正常。小地图上的红点显示敌方单位的，但是不知道是BUG还是怎么，我这一直都显示有个红点，但是就是没见着敌人，我打了灯笼找的啊！
另外碾压过去之后你会发现你的队伍直接就飞出屏幕，回复金钱，但是也没有什么卵用，你得等对方出下一波兵。可是只要对方有一个单位超过你的屏幕，你就输了。沃的法克！你见过打仗打到一半对方说我没兵了然后你就在那儿喝着咖啡等他兵来了再重新开始打么？你不如直接开个新局算了！
本来还期待着有点其他类塔防游戏的精髓的，可惜这一个都没有。我是玩不下去了。
然后给个优点吧。这游戏能+1，哦也。什么？你不+1？那就当我没说过。
最后的总结。TM的别买！进包了就送给你不喜欢的人让他玩就是了。

PS:在我打这篇评测坐等下一波敌军出现的时候有个敌军竟然偷渡过去了……哦也！太机智的AI了，这一局里我被磨蹭了30分钟最后竟然输了！

For people who can not read in chinese.
Don't buy it!

review:
Chciałbym, aby każda gra, którą przyjdzie mi uruchomić, dawała mi nowe doświadczenia, przygody i wyzwania. Żeby gra była poprawnie wykonana i aby rozgrywka, którą oferuje, nie frustrowała, była spójna i miała sens... Ta gra nie spełnia żadnego z tych życzeń, pomimo patchów i rzekomej wersji 1.9 gry to nadal tylko koncept...

Rozgrywka w Shadows of War ma proste założenia, zaczynamy z lewej strony planszy, a przeciwnik z prawej. Cała sztuczka polega na tym, aby produkować jednostki, które będą bardziej skuteczne od tych, które wyprodukuje przeciwnik. Po wyprodukowaniu jednostek możemy ewentualnie zatrzymać jednostki, co zmieni ich kolejność, wyprodukować nalot, który wesprze nasze siły i to w zasadzie wszystko. Rodzajów jednostek jest sporo, od piechoty, poprzez jednostki wsparcia, czołgi, aż po lotnictwo. Wszystko wygląda pięknie i ładnie, tylko jest jeden problem. Rozgrywka na obecnym etapie jest nie zbalansowana, część trybów, które oferuje, w ogóle nie ma sensu, a kampania posiada błędy, które mi uniemożliwiły rozgrywkę już w drugiej misji. To naprawdę jest wersja 1.9? Jeśli tak to polecam zagrać w tę grę przy wersji 6.0. Może wtedy będzie grywalna, do tego czasu żegnam.

Grafika w grze oparta na kontraście jest miła dla oka, a większość odgłosów nie drażni małżowin usznych, szkoda tylko, że poza tymi dwoma aspektami, reszta leży i kwiczy. Jedna z nielicznych gier, którą przyszło mi ocenić, nie przegrawszy w niej nawet dwóch godzin, ale jak mam to zrobić skoro gra wykrzacza się w drugim etapie?

[h1]Ocena
3/10[/h1]

[b]Plusy:
+ Grafika i muzyka fajnie się uzupełniają i tworzą klimat.
+ Ciekawy konspekt rozgrywki...

Minusy:
- ...który został zmarnowany przez twórców.
- Błędy, błędy, błędy....[/b]

review:
Current observations 15/02/2015 

Upon loading game all saved progress has been lost, at last play I had completed the campaign to day 7 I am now back at day 1.

Started up a skirmish map, as before dead enemy units are still showing on map. Ordered up a bunch of infantry units they stoped moving across the map about 15% of the way across, yet ordered up an MLRS and went all the way. During wave 2 game crashed back to desktop.

Game previously did not crash back to desktop, it just got very slow the longer a game was played ( 1 second took around 3 seconds of real time on sped up mode even worse on normal time progression by wave 16-18 and time between waves starting took around 5 mins in campaign mode, wave start delay seemed ok in skirmish ). 

Given the game crashes back to dekstop so quickly I can not comment on if these issues have been fixed.

The dev is active which is a good sign and I have hopes that one day I will manage to complete the game.

Sadly as of today I can not reccomend this game in its current state.


*** 8th March 2015 3rd update to review ***

So my 3rd time trying this game, I still notice that previous progress is missing, I now presume this lost, along with progress towards acheivements.

Started up a classic skirmish, ordered up 20 soldiers, they met up with 20 enemy soldiers with a slight crest between and both stood there for 6+ mins with no casualties, didnt seem to be able to shoot each other. Started up skirmish again on a different map, same again ordered up 20 to face off against first wave of 20 enemy soldiers. Again they faced off with a crest between them. I took a screen short of it this time, nearly 13 mins they just stood opposing each other with no casualties.

3rd Time tried skirmish on a flat map, thankfully this time they were able to shoot each other.

I have played the game almost finishing the campaign and never noticed a LoS issue before, during this play test there did appear to be LoS between the troops and bullet animations were clearly showing hits between the units, so unsure if this is a new issue or just random bad lack that has not happened to me previously.

Crashes seem to have stopped. Fair play this was resolved quickly and caused by a patch that was not intended for release.

Mini map / radar is still largely pointless and quickly stops indincating your units and then shortly after enemy units.

Your own troops still randomly stop moving across the map bunching up in a mass group, this can lead to loosing a large number of units to a single tank / arty shell.

Once a large number of troops that had stopped moving and bunched up on the map just vanished ( well behind any fighting and only on 3rd wave no no arty in play on either side ), can't say I noticed that happening before either.

I would classify the current state of the game as working but frustrating. I have not tested the campaign, since Feb so can not comment regarding speed slowdown issues that occoured previously

[h1]The game is largely like an RTS on a 2D plane. [/h1]

You can spend money to buy infantry units/vehicles/weapons/aircraft, which will collide with the enemy in the middle of the map - the enemy does the same. The amount of money at the beginning is limited, so you need to spend it wisely. The most fun is multiplayer, which is ideal for this type of game.

The basis of the game is that here we do not control individual units, but only choose what, how much and when to buy. If you buy too many infantry, your opponent will be able to buy a raid and you will lose. Speaking of raids There are several support options, such as carpet raids, strike artillery, rockets, etc. They are not cheap, but they can take to the sand some unpleasant heavily armed opponents.

review:
I've been playing this game, prior to the purchase on STEAM, so don't be fooled by the STEAM  time-log.  Don't believe the simple-minded negative reviews, that clearly are not used to "tactics".  Its a great 2D-scrolling application of a battlefield tactics game.  It is deceptively deep, in its use of special team tactics.  If your the type that builds a zerg-massing rush tactic... yeah, you probably won't like this game.  Deploy different groups of units and employ the use of support assets like Artillery and Bombers.

Recommend you play it on the harder levels, so you can appreciate the use of team and asset management more fully.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966022897', 'num_games_owned': 3304, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1420427505}
review:
The game plays largely like a RTS on a 2D plane.  You spend money to purchase infantry/vehicle/tank/air units where you collide in a head-on battle with your enemy which is doing quite the same.  You only have so much money to work with at the start so you need to spend wisely.  I imagine the game's core enjoyment factor will be it's multiplayer which I have yet to try out. 

The game almost plays itself in a sense, you have no real full control over the units you purchase, just in how many you purchase and when, which is primarily the strategy to the game.  If you purchase a bunch of infantry and your opponent purchases an airstrike, that's going to be a lot of money down the drain wasted on infantry.  Speaking of airstrikes there are several support options, such as carpet bombing, artillery strikes, cruise missiles, etc.  These aren't cheap, but they can take out nasty clusters of heavy armor rather quickly.

There is also the option to research vehicles, which is good to slow down the progression of a battle so you don't just pound the enemy with the biggest and baddest things you have on offer, and makes you try to manage your money a little more carefully.  I think once the game has the game-breaking bugs ironed out however it'll be a much better playthrough experience.  I'm honestly on the middle grounds for recommending this game or not, and the only reason why I'd lean more towards the negative side of things is only because the current day-skip bug.  Aside from that the game has many redeeming qualities, though I think a little more variance and strategy would help it a lot more.  Possibly in the form of building barricades to slow down enemy advancement or block projectiles, and really turning it into more of a chess-game where certain types of units are absolutely required to best others, because I feel many will just use the "strength in numbers" tactic, which can work, but it is a costly mistake if it doesn't.  Also a refresh timer on support would be a good idea as well, spamming artillery if you have the cash can do most of the work for you.
